attributes.action: Revamping the A413, to help save innocent lives!
attributes.additional_details: The A413 is a road that links Gerrards Cross to Towcester. It passes through a number of towns & villages. Aylesbury, Amersham & Great Missenden, to name a few. Over the last few years, there have been a significant amount of tragic accidents on this road, mainly between Gerrards Cross & Chalfont St Giles. I for one think enough is enough and something most definitely needs to be done to prevent the loss of innocent peoples lives. I sadly lost my Dad on December 15th 2011 on this road, and am fully aware that other people have lost loved ones too. Now is the time for us all to come together in order for this to be dealt with and to get some sort of justice. It takes 2 minutes & 1 signature to make a difference, please make the effort! Many thanks, Lauren Curtis.

rejection.details: The A413 is a local authority road, and decisions about any revamping rest with the appropriate local highway authority (the relevant county council).
